MCQ: What term was coined in 1959 by Arthur Samuel to describe the field of study concerned with the development and study of statistical algorithms that can learn from data?
Choices: a: Artificial Intelligence | b: Machine Learning | c: Data Mining | d: Predictive Analytics

MCQ: Who introduced a theoretical neural structure formed by certain interactions among nerve cells in the book 'The Organization of Behavior'?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Arthur Samuel | c: Walter Pitts | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' with punched tape memory developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cyberdyne | b: Cybertron | c: Cyberpunk | d: Cyberspace

MCQ: Who provided a widely quoted, more formal definition of the algorithms studied in the machine learning field?
Choices: a: Tom M. Cruise | b: Tom Hanks | c: Tom M. Mitchell | d: Tom Brady

MCQ: What is one of the objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To make coffee | b: To classify data and make predictions | c: To bake cookies | d: To fly to the moon
